Comments_List: how to think about the US healthcare system and reforms, how to critically analyze past reforms in the US sand other countries
Historical overview of American health care, analysis of the constraints of the current health care system, comparison to health care systems abroad and possibilities for universal health care.
Historial, political, and economic perspective on health care reform after the passing of the ACA
I think it may have been better suited as a lecture. Professor Aviles is SO knowledgeable about health care, so sometimes it was frustrating to not hear much from her.

Strengths:
-Excellent spread of reading load and course plan/design
-Engagement with Professor/mini-lectures
-Structure of assignments

Could have used a better understanding of ACA before learning the historical perspective. I think the last book should have come first. Writing memos without the whole picture made me feel uninformed and distrust my own argument.

Highlights of the class were the debates and team activities.
Yes! I learned so much and feel like I can go to DC or state legislatures and discuss health care reform eloquently and with accurate info
Absolutely! Amazing course with a passionate professor.
